white: Accidentally standing up while on VC from home.
A big, fat dump of ARM assembly.
Coming back from lunch and finding my laptop suspended in the middle of a build.
Test suites that have been broken since August.
Extremely weird edge cases in unicode regexes.
Waiting for hours to land code, only to have it fail a test at the last minute.
A comment change showing a 3% MobileLab regression.
A device crash dump with no symbols.
Increasing Buck's Java heap by another 2GB and recompiling.
Conformance tests that no JS engines currently pass.
Writing a Javascript compiler without knowing Javascript.
The panic I feel when I zone out in a meeting and suddenly hear my name.
Trying and failing to find something on internal search.
The placement of the * in pointer declarations.
Giving people the power to build community and bringing the world closer together.
Arguing over Vim and Emacs as if we don't already know the answer.
An awkward conversation with a HRBP.
Copying features from other social media platforms so we can be cool and hip again.
Pretending to be interested in a launch because they're having a happy hour.
A large backlog of ad credits and a sketchy agenda.
Fixing Javascript once and for all.
Constantly talking over people on VC.
JavaScript getters that always ruin optimizations.
Going to a standards committee meeting.
A solution that's simple, elegant and wrong. .
Successfully compiling and running Hello World.
A heated debate about an inconsequential design decision.
Signing up for extra interviews purely for some human interaction.
Spending way too much time on Hacker News.
Inspiring an addition to a mandatory training class.
Overthrowing the government in a communist revolution.
Ignoring tasks until the reaper kills them.
Spending a week landing an 18 diff stack.
The 3GB of address space we need to show cat photos.
Making sure to complain about compensation on Pulse, no matter what.
Procrastinating like no one's procrastinated before.
Figuring out whether or not I'm actually using Hermes.
Charging an admissions fee to let people tour the campus.
Carefully curating the items in my background so people on VC think I'm cool.
An hour long meeting that should have been a group post.
Arc pull --latest just to get a 20 minute break.
A secret plot to spread COVID-19 via 5G towers.
Writing referrals for people I've never met.
Dumping stock on the first day of the trading window.
Stealing food and drinks from unguarded events.
Debugging via printf, since nothing else works.
People bringing their lunch into the bathroom.
Suggesting frivolous changes to diffs so I can land my own without conflicts.
A triple indirection in the VM's critical path.
Trying to find a free conference room in MPK16.
Creeping on my reviewer's calendar when they're slow.
Writing a new JS compiler and VM from scratch.
Getting desperate enough to run `buck clean`.
Getting items For Free @ Facebook and reselling them on eBay.
Self-medicating by drinking bleach and aquarium cleaner.
A two line diff with 350 Sandcastle tests.
Dialing in to a meeting to avoid walking up the stairs.
Posting an impressive number of memes.
Re-reading a section of the JS spec for the eighth time.
An underground economy based on trading diff approvals.
Spending my $1,000 on the loudest keyboard I can find.
Making Peter realize his mistake and come back.
An anatomically correct depiction of Hermes of Olympus.
Taking some PTO and waiting for it all to blow over.
A Hermes white card I have absolutely no context for.
A six hundred line optimization pass that reduces compressed bytecode size by 0.1%.
Clicking "Like" on my own Facebook posts.
Expecting people in London to join meetings at night.
The recruiting strategy of inviting "guest speakers".
Extrapolating based on two SCUBA datapoints.
Quadratic algorithms that worked fine in all the lit tests.
Extra income from stealing office supplies and scalping them outside OfficeMax.
Manually updating 300 lit tests for a ten line diff.
Updating buck for the third time today.
Getting a private office by taking over a single occupancy bathroom.
Reading too much into a round of this game.
Leaking sensitive info in commit messages.
Forgetting I'm on camera in Workrooms.
Trying to remember which day of the week it is.
Slapping spacedog memes on diffs instead of reviewing them properly.
Running hg blame on a nasty piece of code and finding my name.
All of Hermes compiled to Wasm.
A new level of DEBUG macros.
Getting extra vacation days by "working from home".
Putting "manual testing" in the test plan and hoping no one questions it.
Shell scripts, cron jobs, and a stack of unlandable hacks.
A meeting that involves three times as many people as necessary.
A design meeting with no agenda.
Twiddling my thumbs and waiting for my RSUs to vest.
Reverting the diff that deleted JSC.
A Work Chat tab using 6GB of memory.
Attacking people with a broken beer bottle.
Staring at the microkitchen fridge without getting anything.
Correlating our pushes against the FB stock price.
A pile of irrelevant GitHub issues.
Becoming a Hermes manager, then quitting and rejoining FB.
Repeatedly requesting trivial changes to avoid a merge conflict.
Spending the day trying and failing to attach a native debugger.
A curious lack of interest in visiting the Seattle office after passing Prop 64.
Switching to unrelated topics instead of ending a meeting early.
Deleting an intern's project a month after they leave.
A follow-up meeting to a design meeting with no agenda.
Adding a question mark after a long, angry rant and "asking" it on Q&A.
Severely stretching the definition of an "essential business".
Prying git from Tzvetan's cold, dead hands.
